[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Document Sheet System (DSS) defines requirements for managing sheets, text, and geometric objects, ensuring structured document editing and collaboration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DSS supports document creation, multi-sheet management, text editing, and geometric operations with real-time collaboration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DSS integrates with document storage, rendering engines, and collaboration platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DSS provides a graphical interface for managing sheets, text, and objects.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DSS supports desktops and tablets with touch and stylus input.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DSS uses PostgreSQL for storage  REST APIs for object manipulation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DSS secures collaboration via TLS encryption  OAuth 2.0 authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DSS optimizes storage for large sheets  high-volume objects.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: DSS supports real-time editing  auto-saving  rollback.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DSS supports cloud  on-premise deployments with access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DSS integrates with external cloud storage  collaboration tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DSS manages structured text editing  object manipulation  and operations like copy  cut  paste  move  resize.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DSS serves document creators  designers  editors with a customizable UI.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DSS requires a stable internet connection for real-time synchronization.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DSS relies on secure storage  rendering engines  authentication  version control.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with document storage to save  retrieve sheets (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall expose REST APIs for object manipulation (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to create  modify  delete sheets (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support selection  copy  cut  paste  move  resize for text  objects (REQ-DB-001  REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable inserting  modifying  deleting rectangles  circles (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an editor with drag-and-drop  shortcuts  snapping tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process object actions within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store sheets  text  metadata.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track geometric objects  including position  size.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support real-time updates  undo  redo  versioning.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with security policies  access controls  encryption standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log object modifications  text changes  user actions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests document creation  sheet editing  object manipulation  retrieval.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides  API documentation  collaboration manuals  security policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Document management policies  security regulations  usability standards.
